content.label: This game is fantastic! It has a high replay value. The levels are difficult but not unbeatable. There are multiple elements like armor, and shields and weapons. One suggestion for the developers - can you create some type of glossary for knowing every type of enemy? In order to beat the challenges we need a place to go to see the differences between (jerk, vine hjearts, creep, etc.). It would also give information about each of units and objects (rock, ice block, Boulder, etc.) and their weakness, how to defeat them, etc.
Very addicting. Easy to play.

Been playing a couple of days now. It’s fun. I like the animation style. Enjoyable so far, though tough sometimes. Don’t stick around in one level/dungeon too long or good luck getting out. It’s challenging enough to be fun.

Edit: I’ve been having issues multiple times today being attacked by the blue guys that aren’t in attack mode too. Makes it hard to play the game.

Edit(2): Now a purple one did it. It’s happened multiple times when they’re on the 4th square from the top, far left. Done playing for now.

title.label: Game Is a pay to win/continue with no way to buy or continue

content.label: I’m at a point in the game where I have no gems to fix my items and no gems to get health so I forever will have one health unless I get lucky and get a lower lvl. But the game knows your beat it already and rigs the map and drops against you in a way that farming for more gems is basically pointless and lvl 5 becomes as hard if not harder than your current lvl. I’m uninstalling the game...why have a pay to win game model with no way to buy the things that you need? Don’t get me started on my current lvl 5 giant enemy’s drop from the sky and almost every small monster is on fire....game kills itself. Idiot devs

Figuring out paths of attack and means of avoiding counter-attacks are fun and challenging. Just a bit frustrating working out a path ending in a ‘safe’ space, only to be struck by a non-attack ready critter.

Reply: If I remember correctly, it was the blue ones (rotational/spin-whip attack)

I missed a game like this. A really challenging puzzle with lots of variables to play around with. Awesome graphics, very addictive. I can’t subscribe the negative reviews, unless you’re unable to take on a good puzzle challenge. Best game I got from Apple Arcade so far.
I live the entire game enjoyable but i just want to know how to kill a king

title.label: This release has a bad bug

content.label:
My favorite game has a major bug. This has happened repeatedly with the latest release: on the phone, carefully plot a path with Jorge and tap GO. The menu comes up to leave the level and adjust volume levels. Dismiss the menu and the game treats it as if you’ve instructed it to skip your turn. Jerks move and your plotted path is both gone and screwed up.

UPDATE responding to the developer: this has only been experienced on my phone with finger taps. Found a workaround to just force quit the app without dismissing the menu. Then when returning, the tuen hasn’t been skipped. Yes, i have to plot it again, but at least it doesn’t mess me up completely. I have no way to reliably reproduce the bug and it’s unpredictable. Saw on Reddit that others have experienced this.

Thought this just a simple color matching game, but it’s way more. Figuring out what weapons and attire to wear into battle. Or figuring what strategies to use to defeat certain enemies. Love this game!!!!

title.label: Good game, spotty GameCenter Game Saves

content.label:
This is a terrific game, and I was very excited to see there Game Center integration allowed me to progress on the Apple TV or my iPhone. Unfortunately, it seems to not load my profile completely even when I get there pop up that says I’m signed in to my Game Center account. 

Please fix that Game Center integration for perfection.

Update: The GameCenter profile problem has become so bad that I cannot keep playing due to frustration. Not sure it is the fault of the game developer, but I’m quitting this game for now with my sincere best wishes to the developers of this otherwise fantastic game.

Update 2: I figured out the GameCenter problem: separate IDs for store and iCloud. I signed out of GameCenter on my phone (store account) and was automatically signed in with iCloud, with the expected profile. Downloaded Grindstone again and it moved smoothly into my saved games with zero issues. Glad to have resolved this so I can inflame my RSI again wearing out the screen on my iPhone!
Amazing game, even better soundtrack, I would just turn off the game volume and listen to the soundtrack 10/10.
Love this game. The developers clearly put a lot of love into this little beautiful game. Everything is perfect.

This game is awesome and I absolutely adore the music I love getting grindstones, making swords, and killing creeps, 100/10. It’s not hard it’s just as hard as it needs to be and I play it every single day I love the music but the sounds are disgusting
Great puzzle game with beautifully designed characters, stages, and animations. Very easy to jump in and get hooked. I do wish my progress would/could be shared across my devices.

Starts out really fun, but as you progress through levels the game begins to rely heavily on the extremely unimaginative technique of increasing difficulty by throwing more and more obnoxiously overpowered enemies on the board. As though it’s fun to have carefully planned moves ruined by the thief, who has nearly limitless ability to move around the board. Additionally, the player character does not level up in any way through the game. You only gain access to “gotcha” style weapons and defenses that have limited usefulness, and no space to be equipped anyway.

Mechanics were clearly designed for a cash machine game, which somehow ended up in Apple Arcade. It’s a shame.

Realized life is too short to keep playing a game I hate.

Might be the worst “game” on arcade. This service continues to disappoint with its selection. This game is monotonous, boring, and extremely grindy in all the wrong ways. There’s also an extremely deep difficulty curve right off the bat that leaves a bad taste in your mouth out of the gate. Don’t waste your precious time or storage space on this one.
Rdd is the morning time

But boss battles are a long...long....long repetitive road before you get to them. I have all this inventory of tools and weapons and rarely use anything but the warp potion and shield. 
Been playing it almost daily now. 
Fewer stages, more frequent boss battles please.

Today I went to play grindstone because it’s one of my favorite game but when I opened the app I noticed that all my progress had been deleted please fix this bug and get my progress back I was on the tenth level of the second area. if you can restore my data I would give this five stars again
Was great but now it crashes

I loved this game. It’s one of the few I fell in love with after joining arcade. However some of the most recent level updates have had me stalled at level 29. I’m a very casual gamer and once it becomes too technical or complicated I lose interest. That’s what’s happened at 29. The levels were a nice pace and then 29. Sometimes I start the level and I have three lives and the only move leads me to be killed. Hardly encouraging.
The in game music alone makes me play this for hours on end. All games should be this exciting to listen to, let alone play.

Great game. Easily five stars. I just came here to report a bug.

In today’s daily grind (10/26/2020), I chose the hunter uniform and then the “normal” arrows. By the third level, I still had all 3 arrows. I used one for the first time, and it spawned a replacement in the level. As expected, during this turn I went from 3 to 2 arrows. On the next turn, I picked up the arrow that spawned; however, instead of adding 1 to go back to having 3 in my inventory, it ended up subtracting so I suddenly only had 1 left.

Loved this game, thought it might be one i actually complete but nope - after level 100 the  way to beat the level changes. At the first change, you gotta hit 10 or more blue or red + the totem to light it up. Okay, didn’t like it but i could deal. By level 110 all you do is hit a stupid block with a chain of 5 or more, to move it one space, to land it on a square. Yeah no thanks. That is not fun. 

RIP Grindstone. At least for me.
I really like the game but it has crashed over 20 times. Anybody know why?
I love the game but it crashes all the time. So frustrated I’m about to delete it.

We should be able to keep whatever you get in the daily grind games! That’s not right! I need grindstones!!! Level 170 is ridiculous. Help a sister out! Other than that. I’m obsessed with this game. Love how you can raise the gore level. The MUSIC, is amazing. Or rhythms lol
The levels don’t have much variations and the enemies and bosses aren’t challenging

This game was the star of Arcade when it was released. Then it erased my save data, and I was forced to start over. The game would be 5/5, but not protecting save data is huge miss. Nothing kills player enthusiasm other than losing hours and hours of progress. Such a shame.

title.label: Amazing Game But Enemy Names Aren’t Clear

content.label: I don’t know how to finish some challenges because there is no register of enemy types. One challenge is “kill 2 jerks with one chain”...yet there is no way that I know how to find out what type of enemy that enemy looks like. Please ad an enemy registry with names and characteristics. This is the only thing keeping this from being a 5+ star game.
Add more new levels in the next update please!
the best game I’ve ever played👍👍👍❤️❤️
Would be nice to have an option to change your armor every level instead of quitting to main menu to change it.

title.label: Good but health & power up management issue

content.label: Why do I lose my health and power ups if I fail or restart a level? Forcing players to go back and grind for resources is a disappointment and takes away from the progress in the game, similar to the pay to win junk in the App Store. We should be able to restart without being punished, especially with the amount of luck involved in later levels.
Update deleted all of my progress. This went from being my favorite game to deleted. Inexcusable.

title.label: Favorite game to play on the toilet

content.label: The best

title.label: Best Game on App Store Fixed

content.label: Thanks for fixing the new level issues, this is still my favorite game to grind through.

This game is the only reason I pay for Apple Arcade. Grindstone is getting us through quarantine, lol. The design is so *EXTRA* in the best way possible. I used to play Simon’s Cat Crunch on the daily, but this one feels like SCC...on steroids. I so appreciate the ability to “drop loot and run” at any point on a game board, as well as the ability to pick up in the middle of a board after re-opening the app. This was developed so thoughtfully and I really appreciate it. I sometimes let my 5-year-old “help” me play and it actually makes him laugh out loud. We both yell “GUTS!” when we smash a Jerk. I just saw that Nintendo Switch will be getting Grindstone this Fall—we’ll definitely be buying the game!! GET GRINDING, Y’ALL!! PS: To developers: there is an occasional bug with the Jerks who throw arrows—sometimes if you open a board that features them, they’ll be shaking/vibrating super fast and it’s hard to tell when they’re highlighted red ie about to throw an arrow.

title.label: Crushes each time grindstone is attacked

content.label: Pretty annoying. Deleted and re installed the app, didn’t help. Besides the game is great

Every time I start the game, I get this error at the end of the initial startup sequence and cannot play the game. I’ve deleted the game and downloaded it again several times and the problem persists.
Constantly getting pop ups in the middle of games that say user error and I can’t progress. Great game outside of that....

I keep getting game blocking errors with this game. Random code will just overlay upon the screen in a light box. It’s not even human readable error messaging—just actual code about arrays and leaking. It’s incredibly frustrating.

title.label: I can’t put this game down!

content.label: I’m usually not a puzzle game fan, but this one just found its niche in me. I love the animation but if that wasn’t enough the music alone makes me wanna play this games. All the music is incredible.

The app was glitching, it seems to be fixed. The developers actually reached out to me to let me know they were working on it after the only way I could find to contact them was through an app review.
Bug report: Loading crash is fixed.

I haven’t played a good mobile game in so long. The music and artwork is amazing! I was just looking for an excuse to sub to Apple Arcade and this was definitely the game that not only got me into Apple Arcade but back into mobile gaming. Highly recommend this game!
Please someone help me! Every time i get hit my game crashes with a msg that says “EXCEPTION!...” and some other coding nonsense
Addictive

Love this game. Played and completed all levels, still have some challenges left to complete. Frustrated that I can’t play the daily grind because it keeps saying I’m “not authenticated” don’t know what to do. I have removed the app and reinstalled it, I have the the most updated version but it still won’t let me play daily grind, bummer.

title.label: They literally called it a grind.

content.label: Ugh. I want to love these games, but I end up hating them. This one is another in a long list of adventure-puzzle-match-three games like Candy Crush or Best Fiends. Grindstone is dressed up as an Apple Arcade game, but it reeks of a more nefarious money grabber like the others. Here is a summary: 1) great concept with good presentation. 2) progressively harder - by world 2, it already becomes either beyond challenging or pure luck to beat levels (I’m a completionist and go for the crown in every level, which for all intents and purposes is impossible). 3) eventual frustration and deletion. Good for a couple hours. A slog after that. The Achilles heel of all of these games is the random drop engine. These can dictate whether you luck into a 12 move combo or get stuck with only 1 color in each direction. As you move on, the boards become more ridiculous blocked with boulders and crates that can’t be wrecked because there is no way to get combos long enough. Ultimately, this was designed to make money by getting players to buy lives and pay-to-win with charms and stones, but ended up in the Apple Arcade, which is exactly the kind of garbage I hoped to avoid with my subscription. Oh and a bit of constructive feedback: it would be nice if you didn’t have to go to the tavern after every round to refill your lives. It’s a lot of clicking and time wasting for no reason.
